page.title: 13DALRY HEALTH CENTRE
page.content: Dalry Health Centre was opened in 1981 on the site of the old St. Palladius school. Four{doctors}and a trainee are based there. There are {Nursing services, Health Visitors, {Chiropody}for old people and a{School {Dentist.} About 20 people work there. The Centre opens at 8.00am and closes at7.30pm. There are two waiting rooms, offices and consulting rooms. At a regular baby clinic, babies are checked for hearing, sight and weight and given injections against polio, measles, whooping cough etc. There is a Cervical Smear Service for early detection of cancer in women. Preventative medicine and general health care are important parts of the sevice. The Centre is modern and efficient, but some people feel that it lacks the intimacy of the old Doctors' surgeries
